title: Seven essential Excel data visualization tips
text: Tools we’re using today

title: Seven essential Excel data visualization tips
text:
ggplot2

ggplot2 implements the grammar of graphics, a coherent system for describing and building graphs. With ggplot2, you can do more faster by learning one system and applying it in many places. - R4DS

title: Seven essential Excel data visualization tips
text:
A rapid introduction to ggplot2
gg stands for grammar of graphics.

Set up the plot with ggplot()
Add your data
Specify variables with aes()
Choose chart type with geom()
Add new elements as layers with a plus sign (+) between layers
Style with themes

ggplot(data = df_name, 
      aes(x = x_var_name, 
          y = y_var_name)) +
  geom_type() +
  ...

title: Seven essential Excel data visualization tips
text:
A rapid introduction to ggplot2
Set up plot


library(ggplot2)

ggplot(data = ci_np,
       aes(x = year,
           y = visitors)) +
  geom_line()

title: Seven essential Excel data visualization tips
text:
A rapid introduction to ggplot2
Add customization


library(ggplot2)

ggplot(data = ci_np, 
       aes(x = year, 
           y = visitors)) +
  geom_line(
    color = "#028BA8",
    linetype = "dashed"
  )

title: Seven essential Excel data visualization tips
text:
A rapid introduction to ggplot2


library(ggplot2)

ggplot(data = ci_np, 
       aes(x = year, 
           y = visitors)) +
  geom_line(
    color = "#028BA8",
    linetype = "dashed"
  ) +
  theme_minimal()

title: Seven essential Excel data visualization tips
text:
A rapid introduction to ggplot2


library(ggplot2)

ggplot(data = ci_np, 
       aes(x = year, 
           y = visitors)) +
  geom_line(
    color = "#028BA8",
    linetype = "dashed"
  ) +
  theme_minimal() +
  labs(
    x = "Year",
    y = "Annual park visitors",
    title = "Channel Islands NP Visitation",
    subtitle = "(1963 - 2016)"
  )

title: Seven essential Excel data visualization tips
text:
A rapid introduction to ggplot2
The ggplot2 package works best with “tidy data”.


“Wide” format:
park_name `2012`   `2013`   `2014`
<chr>     <int>    <int>    <int>
CI        249594   212029   342161

“Long”/“tidy” format:
park_name visitors   year
<chr>     <int>      <int>
CI        249594     2012
CI        212029     2013
CI        342161     2014

title: Seven essential Excel data visualization tips
text:
gt

With the gt package, anyone can make wonderful-looking tables using the R programming language. The gt philosophy: we can construct a wide variety of useful tables with a cohesive set of table parts. These include the table header, the stub, the column labels and spanner column labels, the table body, and the table footer.

title: Seven essential Excel data visualization tips
Seven essential Excel data visualization tips
text:
A bar plot

library(ggplot2)

ggplot(data = mtcars) +
  geom_bar(aes(x = cyl))

title: Seven essential Excel data visualization tips
text:
A bar plot

library(ggplot2)

ggplot(data = mtcars) +
  geom_bar(aes(x = cyl,
               fill = as.factor(cyl))) +
  theme(legend.position = "none") + 
  labs(title = "ggplot fill")

title: Seven essential Excel data visualization tips
text:
A bar plot

library(ggplot2)

ggplot(data = mtcars) +
  geom_bar(aes(x = cyl,
               fill = as.factor(cyl)),
           color = "black")

title: Seven essential Excel data visualization tips
text:
A bar plot

library(ggplot2)

ggplot(data = mtcars) +
  geom_bar(aes(x = cyl,
               fill = as.factor(cyl)),
           color = "black") +
  theme_minimal() + 
  labs(title = "ggplot fill")

title: Seven essential Excel data visualization tips
text:
Hello, ggpattern!



ggpattern provides custom ggplot2 geoms which support filled areas with geometric and image-based patterns.

title: Seven essential Excel data visualization tips
text:
A bar plot + ggpattern example

library(ggplot2)
library(ggpattern)

ggplot(data = mtcars) +
  geom_bar_pattern(
    aes(x = cyl,
        pattern_fill = as.factor(cyl)), 
    pattern = "stripe",
    fill    = "white",
    color  = "black") +
  theme(legend.position = "none") + 
  labs(title = "ggpattern pattern_fill")

title: Seven essential Excel data visualization tips
text: A bar plot + ggpattern example

title: Seven essential Excel data visualization tips
section: A cuter bar plot + ggpattern example
text:
A cuter bar plot + ggpattern example

library(ggplot2)
library(ggpattern)

ggplot(data = mtcars) +
  geom_bar_pattern(
    aes(x = cyl,
        pattern_fill = as.factor(cyl)), 
    pattern = "placeholder",
    pattern_type = "kitten",
    fill = "white",
    color = "black") +
  labs(title = "ggpattern placeholder image") + 
  theme(legend.position = 'none')

title: Seven essential Excel data visualization tips
section: A cuter bar plot + ggpattern example
text: A cuter bar plot + ggpattern example

title: Seven essential Excel data visualization tips
section: An image bar chart with ggpattern
text:
An image bar chart with ggpattern

library(ggplot2)
library(ggpattern)

logo1 <- "~/R/excel-data-viz-tips-in-r/images/excel.png"
logo2 <- "~/R/excel-data-viz-tips-in-r/images/sheets.png"
logo3 <- "~/R/excel-data-viz-tips-in-r/images/gt-tab.png"

ggplot(data = mtcars) +
  geom_bar_pattern(
    aes(x = cyl,
        pattern_filename = as.factor(cyl)),
    alpha = 0,
    pattern = "image",
    pattern_type = "squish"
  ) +
  scale_pattern_filename_manual(
    values = c(`4` = logo1, `6` = logo2, `8` = logo3)) +
  theme_minimal() +
  theme(legend.position = "none") +
  labs(title = "ggpattern custom image")

title: Seven essential Excel data visualization tips
section: A little more complex world map
text: A little more complex world map

title: Seven essential Excel data visualization tips
text:
A world map with data
Using this week’s TidyTuesday data!

library(dplyr)
owid_energy <- 
  readr::read_csv('https://raw.githubusercontent.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday/master/data/2023/2023-06-06/owid-energy.csv')

owid_energy_2021 <-
  owid_energy |>
  filter(year == 2021) |>
  mutate(
    country =
      case_match(
        country,
        "United States" ~ "USA",
        "United Kingdom" ~ "UK",
        "Cote d'Ivoire" ~ "Ivory Coast",
        "Democratic Republic of Congo" ~ "Democratic Republic of the Congo",
        "Congo" ~ "Republic of Congo",
        "Czechia" ~ "Czech Republic",
        .default = country
      )
  )

title: Seven essential Excel data visualization tips
text:
A world map with data

world_energy <- 
  map_data("world") |>
  left_join(owid_energy_2021, join_by(region == country))

title: Seven essential Excel data visualization tips
text:
A world map with data

ggplot(data = world_energy,)+
  geom_map(map = world_energy,
           aes(x = long,
               y = lat, 
               map_id = region,
               fill = per_capita_electricity),
           color = "white", 
           size = 0.3)

title: Seven essential Excel data visualization tips
section: A world map with data and style
text:
A world map with data and style

library(MexBrewer)

ggplot(data = world_energy) +
  geom_map(map = world_energy,
           aes(x = long,
               y = lat, 
               map_id = region,
               fill = log(per_capita_electricity)),
           color = "white", 
           size = 0.3) +
  scale_fill_gradientn(colors = mex.brewer("Revolucion"),
                       name = "1000's of kWh") +
  theme_void() +
  theme(legend.position="bottom") +
  labs(title = "Energy use per person, 2021",
       subtitle = "Energy use not only includes electricity, but other also areas of consumption including transport, heating, and cooking.")

title: Seven essential Excel data visualization tips
text:
A U.S. map

library(ggplot2)
library(maps)

state <- map_data("state")

ggplot(data = state) +
  geom_map(map = state,
           aes(x = long, 
               y = lat, 
               map_id = region),
           color = "white") +
  ggtitle("U.S. Map")

title: Seven essential Excel data visualization tips
text: A U.S. map

title: Seven essential Excel data visualization tips
text:
A U.S. map with data

library(dplyr)

us_data_2023 <-
  readxl::read_excel("data/table_5_04_b.xlsx",
                     skip = 3) |> 
  transmute(state = tolower(`Census Division\r\nand State`),
         energy = `March 2023 YTD...2`)

us_map <- 
  map_data("state") |>
  left_join(us_data_2023, join_by(region == state))

A U.S. map with data

library(maps)

ggplot(data = us_map) +
  geom_map(map = us_map,

               y = lat,

title: Seven essential Excel data visualization tips
text:
Color scales
Also known as “heatmaps”.

title: Seven essential Excel data visualization tips
text:
A heatmap with ggplot2

USPersonalExpenditure

                      1940   1945  1950 1955  1960
Food and Tobacco    22.200 44.500 59.60 73.2 86.80
Household Operation 10.500 15.500 29.00 36.5 46.20
Medical and Health   3.530  5.760  9.71 14.0 21.10
Personal Care        1.040  1.980  2.45  3.4  5.40
Private Education    0.341  0.974  1.80  2.6  3.64

title: Seven essential Excel data visualization tips
text:
A heatmap with ggplot2

library(tidyr)

upe <-
  USPersonalExpenditure |> 
  as_tibble(rownames = NA) |> 
  tibble::rownames_to_column("categories") |> 
  pivot_longer(cols = `1940`:`1960`,
               names_to = "year",
               values_to = "expenditures")

head(upe)

# A tibble: 6 × 3
  categories          year  expenditures
  <chr>               <chr>        <dbl>
1 Food and Tobacco    1940          22.2
2 Food and Tobacco    1945          44.5
3 Food and Tobacco    1950          59.6
4 Food and Tobacco    1955          73.2
5 Food and Tobacco    1960          86.8
6 Household Operation 1940          10.5

title: Seven essential Excel data visualization tips
text:
A heatmap with ggplot2

library(ggplot2)

ggplot(data = upe, 
       aes(x = year, 
           y = categories, 
           fill = expenditures)) +
  geom_tile() +
  scale_fill_gradient(low = "#368990",
                      high = "#F4C659",
                      guide = "none")

title: Seven essential Excel data visualization tips

A heatmap with ggplot2

ggplot(data = upe,
       aes(x = year,
           y = categories,
           fill = expenditures)) +
  geom_tile(color = "white",
            size = 0.3) +
  scale_fill_gradient(low = "#368990",
                      high = "#F4C659",
                      guide = "none") +
  theme(axis.title.x = element_blank(),
        axis.title.y = element_blank())

title: Seven essential Excel data visualization tips
text: A heatmap with ggplot2

title: Seven essential Excel data visualization tips
text:
A heatmap with ggplot2

ggplot(data = upe,
       aes(x = year,
           y = categories,
           fill = expenditures)) +
  geom_tile(color = "white",
            size = 0.3) +
  geom_text(aes(label = scales::dollar(expenditures)),
            color = "white") +
  scale_fill_gradient(low = "#368990",
                      high = "#F4C659",
                      guide = "none") +
  theme_minimal() +
  theme(axis.title.x = element_blank(),
        axis.title.y = element_blank()) +
  labs(title = "United States Personal Expenditures",
       subtitle = "(in billions of dollars)")

title: Seven essential Excel data visualization tips

Hello, gtExtras!



7 themes that style almost every element of a gt table
Helper functions for aligning/padding numbers, adding fontawesome icons, images, highlighting, and more

…and way more!

title: Seven essential Excel data visualization tips
text:
REPT Charts
Also known as unit plots, dot plots, etc..

title: Seven essential Excel data visualization tips
text:
REPT Charts in ggplot2

library(ggplot2)

ggplot(data = airquality) +
  geom_dotplot(aes(x = Ozone),
               dotsize = .75, 
               stackratio = 1.2, 
               fill = "steelblue") +
  theme_minimal() +
  coord_flip()

title: Seven essential Excel data visualization tips
text: Data bars

title: Seven essential Excel data visualization tips
text:
Data bars in ggplot2

library(ggplot2)

ggplot(data = mtcars) +
  geom_bar(aes(x = cyl,
               fill = as.factor(cyl)),
           color = "black") +
  theme(legend.position = "none") + 
  labs(title = "ggplot fill")

title: Seven essential Excel data visualization tips
text:
Data bars in ggplot2

library(ggplot2)

ggplot(data = mtcars) +
  geom_bar(aes(x = cyl,
               fill = as.factor(cyl)),
           color = "black") +
  theme(legend.position = "none") + 
  labs(title = "ggplot fill") +
  coord_flip()

title: Seven essential Excel data visualization tips
text:
Data bars in ggplot2

library(ggplot2)

ggplot(data = mtcars) +
  geom_bar(aes(x = cyl,
               fill = as.factor(cyl)),
           color = "black") +
  theme(legend.position = "none") +
  labs(title = "ggplot fill") +
  coord_flip() +
  geom_text(
    stat = "count",
    aes(x = cyl, y = after_stat(count), 
        label = after_stat(count)),
    hjust = 1.3,
    color = "black",
    size = 8)

title: Seven essential Excel data visualization tips
text:
Installing required packages
To run the code in this presentation, please run the following code:
if (!require("pak")) install.packages("pak")
pak::pkg_install("tidyverse", "ggpattern", "gt", "gtExtras", "maps")

title: Seven essential Excel data visualization tips
text: Create plots with esquiesse

title: Seven essential Excel data visualization tips
text:
Save output
ggplot2
ggsave(
  filename,
  plot = last_plot(),
  device = NULL,
  path = NULL,
  scale = 1,
  width = NA,
  height = NA,
  units = c("in", "cm", "mm", "px"),
  dpi = 300,
  limitsize = TRUE,
  bg = NULL,
  ...
)

title: Seven essential Excel data visualization tips
text:
Save output
gt
as_word(
  data,
  align = "center",
  caption_location = c("top", "bottom", "embed"),
  caption_align = "left",
  split = FALSE,
  keep_with_next = TRUE
)

title: Seven essential Excel data visualization tips
text:
Resources
Learning R as an Excel user

Hadley Wickham, Mine Çetinkaya-Rundel, & Garrett Grolemund: R for Data Science
Julie Lowndes & Allison Horst: R for Excel users
Tanya Shapiro: Intro to ggplot2
Jumping Rivers Blog

World maps

Geeks for Geeks: How to make a world map with R
